definition: lit. hair stands up in anger and tips off one's hat (idiom)/fig. seething in anger/raise one's hackles
anger/fury/flourishing/vigorous
hair/Taiwan pr. [fa3]
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
powerful/vigorous/pungent/towards/in view of
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
to put on a hat/to be first/to dub
hat/crown/crest/cap
surname Guan

sentences.english: Mr Uribe's reaction was characteristically combative.
sentences.chinese: 乌里韦先生的反应是怒发冲冠。

sentences.english: He stays calm and never gets angry or too excited.
sentences.chinese: 他总是很平静，从不过怒发冲冠，也不过度兴奋。

sentences.english: A friend you have had disagreements with may wave the red flag.
sentences.chinese: 一个曾和你有分歧的朋友会对你怒发冲冠。

sentences.english: When I heard of cruelty to animals it makes me see red.
sentences.chinese: 我听说残忍虐待动物，就怒发冲冠。

sentences.english: You could see her hackles rising as she heard him outline his plan.
sentences.chinese: 你可以看到，当她听到他描述他的计画就怒发冲冠。

sentences.english: The letter to bristle when the interface XiaoJian summer beauty immediately picked up.
sentences.chinese: 怒发冲冠的信介立即让夏美把小健接走了。

sentences.english: My neighbor flew into a rage when our dog stole his newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 我的邻居在我们的狗偷了他的报纸时怒发冲冠。

definition: to get really angry
stamp with fury/fly into a rage
lit. to slap the table and stand up (idiom); fig. at the end of one's tether/unable to take it any more
lit. furrowed brows and blazing eyes/to dart looks of hate at sb (idiom)
unable to restrain one's anger (idiom); in a towering rage
lit. spouting smoke through the seven orifices (idiom)/fig. to seethe with anger
extremely angry/infuriated
to scowl and stare down/to defy
to get angry/to fume
righteous indignation fills one's breast (idiom); to feel indignant at injustice
scowling in anger/rage written across one's face
eye socket
to fly into a rage/to rage violently
to get angry
flustered and exasperated/utterly discomfited
to glare at
